column1: Dec. 17-19, 2021, Washington Post-University of Maryland poll of 1,101 adults with an error margin of +/- 4 percentage points. *= less than 0.5%
1. How proud are you of the way democracy works in America – very proud, somewhat proud, not very proud, or not at all proud?
3. Do you think protesters who entered the U.S. Capitol on January 6, 2021, were mostly peaceful or mostly violent?
4. Do you think the legal punishments for people who broke into the U.S. Capitol have been (too harsh), (not harsh enough), or have they been fair?
5. Do you think that some protesters injured police officers while trying to break into the U.S. Capitol on January 6, or did everyone act peacefully?
6. How much responsibility do you think Donald Trump bears for the attack on the U.S. Capitol?
7. Regardless of whom you supported in the 2020 election, do you think Joe Biden’s election as president was legitimate, or was he not legitimately elected?
8. Do you think there is solid evidence that there was widespread voter fraud in the 2020 election, or no solid evidence?
9a. Thinking ahead to the 2022 midterm elections for Congress, how confident are you that votes across the country will be counted accurately?
9b. Thinking ahead to the 2022 midterm elections for Congress, how confident are you that all eligible citizens in the U.S. will have a fair opportunity to vote?
10. In states where the government is mostly controlled by Republicans, how confident are you that state officials will accept the results of an election if their party loses?
11. In states where the government is mostly controlled by Democrats, how confident are you that state officials will accept the results of an election if their party loses?
12. Do you think it is ever justified for citizens to take violent action against the government, or is it never justified?
